name: thin-react-context
description: This code defines a React context for managing user data in a React application. It imports the React library and a User type from 'thin-backend'. Then, it defines a UserContext interface with four properties: user, userId, setUser, and setUserId. The UserContext is created with default values using React.createContext, which initializes a new context with a default state consisting of user and userId as null, and empty setter functions for setUser and setUserId.
author: Bradley Dirheimer
